Class Problem

A logic program. Contains a set of prositions, rules for the propositions, and general clauses.

Inheritance

Constructors

Problem(String)

Make a new logic program into which we can enter propositions and rules.

Declaration
public Problem(string name = "unnamed")
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String name

Fields

Current

Current problem into which to intern propositions. This is needed because when you create a proposition or negation, it needs to be placed in a hash table so that when you look it up in the future, you get the same proposition/literal. That means we need to know which Problem it's a part of, so we can add it to the right table.

Declaration
public static Problem Current
Field Value
Type Description
Problem

CompilationTime

Number of microsections spent computing the completions of rules

Declaration
public float CompilationTime { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Single

CreationTime

Number of microseconds spent building the problem object itself. This is the time spent making propositions and predicates, calling Assert, etc. It's measured as elapsed time from the calling of the constructor to the calling of the FinishRuleCompilation() method.

Declaration
public float CreationTime { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Single

Assert(Assertable[])

Adds a set of assertions to this problem. Assertions are immutable: they cannot be changed or reset Assertions cannot be edded after the first call to Solve()

Declaration
public void Assert(params Assertable[] assertions)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Assertable[] assertions

Assertions to add (literals, rules, implications, etc.)
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.InvalidOperationException

When the Problem has already been solved once

Assert(Biconditional)

Asserts that in any solution, either the head and body must both be true or both be false Assertions are immutable: they cannot be changed or reset Assertions cannot be edded after the first call to Solve()

IsConstant(Literal)

True if this is a Literal with a fix truth value across all Problems and Solutions. The only constant Literals are Proposition.True, Proposition.False, and their negations.

Declaration
